original_definition: 'deactivation period' means the period for ramping from full delivery to a set point, or from full withdrawal back to a set point;
generated_definition: 'deactivation period' means the minimum duration between the end of deactivation period and the following activation, as specified in article [article number] of [legislative document].

Article 2: ‘deactivation period’ means the period for ramping from full delivery to a set point, or from full withdrawal back to a set point;
Article 25: minimum duration between the end of deactivation period and the following activation.
